chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Michael Grunert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse  Injunction

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to 22CF361 and 22CF466 and concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a Batterers Intervention program at the Alma Center.
Complete a parenting class.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Comply with any treatment at the discretion of the agent.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UA's.  If defendant has any positive urine screen Court order defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.

No use or possession  of firearms.
No contact with victim without Court approval.
No contact with C.W., J.W., L.W. and N.W.  Court will allow contact with L.W. after the defendant has completed all programming and the probation agent believes it is appropriate. If Family Court Order is more restrictive Family Court Order to take precedence.
Court will allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of childcare.  Court will allow agent to determine 3rd party contact.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay the domestic abuse assessment fee.
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  if defendant is revoked on case 21CF3724 Court orders all mandatory costs and assessments s to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.
-Court set restitution at zero.
On 9/30/2022:  Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 22CF361 and 22CF466 and concurrent with any other sentence.
STAYED and used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Michael Grunert

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: CLERK ERROR:  As to Sentencing Hearing on 10-3-2022, Court ordered 60 days condition time to be STAYED AND USED AT THE DISCRETION OF THE AGENT.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Sean Michael Grunert.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by CW, JW, and RV.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to 22CF361 and 22CF466 and concurrent to any other sentence.

Court placed defendant on Probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- AS TO CASE 22CF81, Court ordered 60 days condition time consecutive to case 21CF2962, 21CF3725, 21CF5003, and 21CM349.
- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, random UAs.  If defendant has any positive urine screen, Court orders defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.
- Comply with any treatment at the discretion of the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work.
- No contact with victim without Court approval.
- No contact with CW, JW, LW, and NW.  Court will allow contact with LW after the defendant has completed all programming and the probation agent believes it is appropriate. If family court order is more restrictive, family court order to take precedence.  
- Court will allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of childcare.  Court will allow agent to determine 3rd party contact.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $0. 

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  If defendant is revoked on case 21CF3724, Court orders all mandatory costs and assessments to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Sean Michael Grunert.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Court began sentencing.  Statement from victim.  Due the lateness of the hour, Court adjourns case for 10/3/2022 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Sean Michael Grunert.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4, AND 5: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Sean Michael Grunert.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date prior to jury trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/10/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests a resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
GRUNERT REPORT dated 5/19/2020, filed.
Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Defense counsel withdraws bail motion. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert not in court, defendant in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Defense counsel does NOT appear. Court adjourns case for defense counsel to be present. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CRW.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $30,000.00.  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Sean Michael Grunert in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean Michael Grunert not in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Return on Warrant/ Initial Appearance.   Defendant failing to appear, Court continued warrant until next hearing, Branch 35.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
